ground_truth: Snape waves the moth away, blows out a candle, and a slide show begins, displaying an ancient woodcut of a horrific beast at the front of the room. Ron frowns down at his book while the class stares mutely at a slide of an attacking werewolf; Hermione waits desperately for someone to respond to Snape's question. The moth flutters by Harry, releasing a tiny cloud of moth dust into the air, which Harry lifts his palm to. Meanwhile, Malfoy's parchment reappears, and Harry stares at it, observing a crude caricature of himself in Quidditch robes being struck by lightning repeatedly. Later, Harry opens his eyes as Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione slowly come into focus, standing at the foot of his bed in the hospital wing. As Harry edges up against his pillow, a nurse in the background removes the spokes of an umbrella from a Hufflepuff player's neck, prompting uncomfortable glances. Someone tips a bag of splintered wood and twisted twigs onto his bed. As Harry stares, a gentle wind can be heard, then Harry shakes his head in response to Lupin's question and sets Hedwig free of her traces. As she soars into the sky, Harry and Lupin watch from the lake's edge. The great doors open and Fred and George enter, dropping the Invisibility Cloak to reveal a cross-looking Harry. Fred slaps a worn roll of parchment into Harry's hand, which he unfurls to find it blank until George touches his wand to the parchment, causing intricate ink lines to surface and spread like veins. Harry reads the curious words at the top. A trapdoor lifts, and Harry's eyes appear as he pulls himself up, but a door bangs open. Quickly, Harry hides and watches a man's boots descend the stairs as Malfoy's eyes shift and regard Hermione with disgust. Suddenly, SPLAT! Malfoy takes a snowball to the grill and splutters. Malfoy glances about in confusion when two more snowballs hit him. Hermione and Ron glance about uneasily as Crabbe and Goyle start for them, but then FLUMPH! their knees buckle and they fall headfirst into the snow. Draco begins to back away fearfully, eyeing the mist, when his ski mask is pulled over his eyes, he's spun about, kicked roughly, and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Ron and Hermione stand frozen, exchange a nervous glance, and dash off, but go flying and land on their pants in the snow. As they sit up, they hear laughter, and Hermione's eyes narrow in suspicion. The Invisibility Cloak drops to reveal a grinning Harry, who is smiling as the trio trudge through the swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Snape gestures the moth aside, extinguishes a candle, and a presentation initiates, showcasing an ancient engraving of a terrifying creature at the front of the chamber. Ron scowls down at his volume while the class gazes silently at a slide of an attacking lycanthrope; Hermione awaits anxiously for someone to reply to Snape's inquiry. The moth flits by Harry, emitting a tiny cloud of moth particles into the air, which Harry raises his hand to. Meanwhile, Malfoy's parchment reappears, and Harry observes it, noting a crude caricature of himself in Quidditch attire being struck by lightning repeatedly. Later, Harry opens his eyes as Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione gradually come into clarity, standing at the foot of his bed in the hospital wing. As Harry edges up against his pillow, a nurse in the background extracts the ribs of an umbrella from a Hufflepuff athlete's neck, prompting uncomfortable glances. Someone pours a bag of splintered wood and twisted twigs onto his bed. As Harry stares, a gentle breeze can be heard, then Harry shakes his head in response to Lupin's inquiry and releases Hedwig free of her bindings. As she ascends into the sky, Harry and Lupin observe from the lake's edge. The great doors open and Fred and George enter, dropping the Invisibility Cloak to reveal a cross-looking Harry. Fred slaps a worn scroll of parchment into Harry's hand, which he unfurls to find it blank until George touches his wand to the parchment, causing complex ink lines to appear and spread like veins. Harry reads the curious words at the top. A trapdoor lifts, and Harry's eyes emerge as he pulls himself up, but a door bangs open. Quickly, Harry conceals and watches a man's boots descend the stairs as Malfoy's eyes shift and regard Hermione with revulsion. Suddenly, SPLAT! Malfoy receives a snowball to the grill and splutters. Malfoy glances about in confusion when two more snowballs strike him. Hermione and Ron glance about uneasily as Crabbe and Goyle start for them, but then FLUMPH! their knees give way and they fall headfirst into the snow. Draco begins to retreat fearfully, eyeing the fog, when his ski mask is pulled over his eyes, he's spun around, kicked roughly, and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Ron and Hermione stand frozen, exchange a tense look, and dash off, but go flying and land on their pants in the snow. As they sit up, they hear laughter, and Hermione's eyes narrow in suspicion. The Invisibility Cloak drops to reveal a grinning Harry, who is smiling as the trio trudge through the swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Snape waves the moth away, a candle is blown out by him, and an ancient woodcut of a horrific beast is displayed by a slide show at the front of the room. Ron frowns down at his book while the class stares mutely at a slide of an attacking werewolf; Hermione waits desperately for someone to respond to Snape's question. The moth flutters by Harry, releasing a tiny cloud of moth dust into the air, which Harry lifts his palm to. Meanwhile, Malfoy's parchment reappears, and a crude caricature of Harry in Quidditch robes being struck by lightning repeatedly is observed by him. Later, Harry opens his eyes as Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione slowly come into focus, standing at the foot of his bed in the hospital wing. As Harry edges up against his pillow, the spokes of an umbrella are removed by a nurse from a Hufflepuff player's neck, prompting uncomfortable glances. Someone tips a bag of splintered wood and twisted twigs onto his bed. As Harry stares, a gentle wind can be heard, then Harry shakes his head in response to Lupin's question and sets Hedwig free of her traces. As she soars into the sky, Harry and Lupin watch from the lake's edge. The great doors are opened and Fred and George enter, dropping the Invisibility Cloak to reveal a cross-looking Harry. Fred slaps a worn roll of parchment into Harry's hand, which is unfurled by him to find it blank until George touches his wand to the parchment, causing intricate ink lines to surface and spread like veins. Harry reads the curious words at the top. A trapdoor lifts, and Harry's eyes appear as he pulls himself up, but a door bangs open. Quickly, Harry hides and watches a man descend the stairs as Malfoy's eyes shift and regard Hermione with disgust. Suddenly, SPLAT! Malfoy takes a snowball to the grill and splutters. Malfoy glances about in confusion when two more snowballs hit him. Hermione and Ron glance about uneasily as Crabbe and Goyle start for them, but then FLUMPH! their knees buckle and they fall headfirst into the snow. Draco begins to back away fearfully, eyeing the mist, when his ski mask is pulled over his eyes, he's spun about, kicked roughly, and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Ron and Hermione stand frozen, exchange a nervous glance, and dash off, but they go flying and land on their pants in the snow. As they sit up, laughter is heard by them, and Hermione's eyes narrow in suspicion. The Invisibility Cloak is dropped to reveal a grinning Harry, who smiles as the trio trudge through the swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Snape dismisses the moth, extinguishes a candle, and starts a slideshow with an ancient woodcut of a horrific beast. As Ron frowns at his book, the class silently watches a werewolf slide; Hermione eagerly awaits answers to Snape's question. The moth flutters by Harry, releasing dust, which he catches. Malfoy's parchment reappears, showing a caricature of Harry in Quidditch robes repeatedly struck by lightning. Later, Harry sees Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione at his hospital bed while a nurse removes an umbrella spoke from a Hufflepuff player's neck. Someone dumps splintered wood onto Harry's bed. Hearing a gentle wind, Harry shakes his head at Lupin's question and releases Hedwig, watching her soar with Lupin. Fred and George enter, revealing a cross Harry. Fred hands him a blank parchment that reveals ink lines when George touches it with a wand. Harry reads the words at the top. When he lifts a trapdoor, a door bangs open; he hides, watching boots descend as Malfoy eyes Hermione with disgust. SPLAT! A snowball hits Malfoy, followed by two more. As Crabbe and Goyle approach, their knees buckle, making them fall into the snow. Draco backs away fearfully, his ski mask pulled over his eyes, spun, and kicked away. Ron and Hermione, startled, flee but fall into the snow, hearing laughter. Hermione's eyes narrow suspiciously as the Invisibility Cloak reveals a grinning Harry, and the trio laughs as they walk through swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Snape dismisses a moth, extinguishes a candle, and starts a slideshow of a beast. Ron frowns at his book, the class silent before a werewolf image, while Hermione awaits answers to Snape's question. A moth dusts Harry, who lifts his hand. Malfoy's parchment shows him in Quidditch robes hit by lightning. Harry awakens in the hospital, sees friends, and a nurse removes umbrella spokes from a player's neck, causing unease. Splintered wood is poured onto his bed. Harry, hearing wind, shakes his head at Lupin's question and frees Hedwig. Watching her soar, Harry and Lupin stand by a lake. The doors open as Fred and George unveil a cross Harry, giving him a blank parchment that reveals ink lines when tapped by George. Harry reads it. A trapdoor lifts, then Harry hides when a door bangs and a man's boots descend, Malfoy glaring at Hermione. Suddenly, Malfoy is hit by snowballs, glancing around confused. Crabbe and Goyle fall in the snow as Malfoy retreats, tripped by his ski mask, and vanishes over a rise. Ron and Hermione fall in snow, hear laughter, and see Harry, grinning as they walk through swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Snape gently waves the bothersome moth away with a flick of his hand, extinguishes the candle with a soft blow, and initiates a slide show presentation. At the front of the classroom, an ancient woodcut depicting a terrifying and grotesque beast is prominently displayed for all to see. Ron, puzzled and slightly perturbed, frowns deeply as he peers down at his book, while the rest of the class stares silently, transfixed by the alarming slide showing an aggressive werewolf in mid-attack. Hermione waits with bated breath, a hint of desperation in her eyes, hoping for someone—anyone—to finally respond to Snape's probing question. 

The moth flutters its delicate wings as it passes by Harry, releasing a tiny, almost invisible cloud of moth dust into the air. Harry lifts his palm thoughtfully to the dust as it gently settles. Meanwhile, Malfoy's piece of parchment mysteriously reappears, drawing Harry's attention. He stares at it, bemused, observing a crude and mocking caricature of himself wearing Quidditch robes, repeatedly struck by jagged bolts of lightning. 

Later, Harry gradually opens his eyes, momentarily disoriented, to see Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione slowly coming into focus as they stand attentively at the foot of his hospital wing bed. As Harry shifts, edging himself closer against the comforting pillow, he notices a nurse in the background carefully extracting the spokes of an umbrella from a Hufflepuff player's neck, prompting a series of uncomfortable glances among them. Someone tips out a bag filled with splintered wood and twisted twigs onto his bed. As Harry gazes at the curious pile, a gentle wind whispers through the room, then Harry resolutely shakes his head in response to Lupin's question before setting Hedwig free from her traces. As the owl takes flight and soars gracefully into the open sky, Harry and Lupin stand together by the lake's edge, watching her ascend.

The great doors swing open with a sense of purpose as Fred and George enter, dropping the Invisibility Cloak to reveal a cross-looking Harry. Fred vigorously slaps a well-worn roll of parchment into Harry's hand, which he carefully unfurls, revealing its apparent blankness until George touches his wand to the surface of the parchment, causing intricate ink lines to emerge and spread like veins across the page. Harry reads the curious and mysterious words at the top.

A trapdoor lifts with a creak, revealing Harry's eyes as he pulls himself up cautiously, but the sudden banging of a door startles him. Quickly, he hides from view and watches intently as a pair of men's boots makes its descent down the stairs. Malfoy's eyes shift, filled with disdain, as he regards Hermione with visible disgust. In an unexpected turn, SPLAT! Malfoy takes a direct hit to the face with a snowball and sputters indignantly. Glancing around in utter confusion, Malfoy is struck by two more snowballs. Hermione and Ron glance around uneasily, feeling the tension as Crabbe and Goyle start toward them. But then, FLUMPH! their knees buckle unexpectedly, sending them tumbling headfirst into the snow.

Draco begins to retreat, clearly afraid, eyeing the mist apprehensively. Just then, his ski mask is yanked abruptly over his eyes, he's spun around, kicked roughly, and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Ron and Hermione stand frozen for a moment, exchanging nervous glances before dashing off, only to slip comically and land awkwardly on their pants in the snow. As they sit up and brush themselves off, they hear the unmistakable sound of laughter. Hermione's eyes narrow with suspicion as the Invisibility Cloak drops, revealing a grinning Harry. The trio, now reunited, smiles as they trudge together through the swirling, picturesque snow.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
With a gentle flick of his hand, Snape waves the bothersome moth away, shooing it from his presence, and then extinguishes the candle with a soft, purposeful blow. He initiates a slide show presentation seamlessly. At the front of the classroom, prominently displayed for all to see, is an ancient woodcut that chillingly depicts a terrifying and grotesque beast. Ron, puzzled and slightly perturbed by the unsettling image, frowns deeply as he peers down at his book, while the rest of the class stares silently, transfixed by the alarming slide displaying an aggressive werewolf caught in the midst of an attack. Hermione waits with bated breath, a hint of desperation flickering in her eyes, hoping desperately for someone—anyone at all—to finally muster the courage to respond to Snape's probing question.

The moth delicately flutters its intricate wings as it drifts by Harry, releasing a tiny, almost invisible cloud of moth dust that disperses into the air. Harry thoughtfully lifts his palm to the dust as it gently settles upon him. Meanwhile, Malfoy's piece of parchment mysteriously reappears, capturing Harry's attention with sudden intrigue. He stares at it, bemused and curious, observing a crude and mocking caricature of himself dressed in Quidditch robes, being repeatedly struck by jagged bolts of lightning.

Later on, Harry gradually opens his eyes, momentarily disoriented and trying to gain his bearings, to see the familiar figures of Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione slowly coming into focus as they stand attentively at the foot of his hospital wing bed. As Harry shifts, edging himself closer into the comforting support of the pillow, he notices a nurse diligently working in the background. She carefully extracts the spokes of an umbrella from a Hufflepuff player's neck, a sight that prompts a series of uncomfortable glances among them all. Someone then tips out a bag filled with splintered wood and twisted twigs onto his bed. As Harry gazes at the curious pile, a gentle wind softly whispers through the room. Then, with determination, Harry resolutely shakes his head in response to Lupin's question before setting Hedwig free from her traces. As the owl takes flight and soars gracefully into the open sky, Harry and Lupin stand together by the edge of the lake, watching her ascend higher and higher.

The great wooden doors swing open with a sense of purpose as Fred and George enter the room confidently, letting the Invisibility Cloak drop to reveal a cross-looking Harry beneath. Fred vigorously slaps a well-worn roll of parchment into Harry's hand, which he carefully unfurls, revealing its apparent blankness that seems puzzling until George touches his wand to the surface of the parchment, causing intricate ink lines to emerge and spread like veins across the page. Harry reads the curious and mysterious words that appear at the top.

A trapdoor lifts with a creak, revealing Harry's cautious eyes as he pulls himself up. Suddenly, the banging of a door startles him. Quickly, he hides from view and watches intently as a menacing pair of men's boots makes its descent down the stairs. Malfoy's eyes shift, filled with disdain and derision, as he regards Hermione with visible disgust. In an unexpected turn of events, SPLAT! Malfoy takes a direct hit to the face with a snowball and sputters indignantly. Frantically glancing around in utter confusion, Malfoy is struck by two more snowballs. Hermione and Ron glance around uneasily, feeling the tension as Crabbe and Goyle begin to advance toward them. But then, FLUMPH! their knees buckle unexpectedly, sending them tumbling headfirst into the snow.

Draco begins to retreat, clearly afraid and unnerved, eyeing the swirling mist with apprehension. Just then, his ski mask is yanked abruptly over his eyes, he's spun around, kicked roughly, and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Ron and Hermione stand frozen for a moment, exchanging nervous glances before dashing off in haste, only to slip comically and land awkwardly on their pants in the snow. As they sit up and brush themselves off, they hear the unmistakable sound of laughter echoing around them. Hermione's eyes narrow with suspicion as the Invisibility Cloak drops, revealing a grinning Harry. The trio, now happily reunited, smiles warmly as they trudge together through the swirling, picturesque snow, enjoying the camaraderie of the moment.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the dimly lit room, Snape flicks his wrist to gently wave the moth away, then leans forward to extinguish the candle's flame, plunging the room into darkness as a slide show flickers to life, casting an ancient woodcut of a horrific beast onto the screen at the room's front. Ron wrinkles his brow and lowers his gaze to the book laid open before him, while the rest of the class sits in silence, eyes fixed on the chilling image of an attacking werewolf projected onto the screen. Hermione, seated among them, anxiously shifts her gaze between Snape and her classmates, yearning for someone to break the silence by answering his question. The moth, undeterred, flutters near Harry, releasing a delicate puff of moth dust into the air, which Harry instinctively lifts his palm to inspect. Concurrently, Malfoy's parchment materializes once more, capturing Harry's gaze as he examines it and discerns a crude caricature of himself donned in Quidditch robes under repeated lightning strikes. As time passes, Harry's eyelids drift open to reveal Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione's familiar faces gradually sharpening into focus as they stand at his hospital bed's foot. Shifting slightly, Harry props against his pillow while observing a nurse in the background carefully extracting the spokes of an umbrella from a Hufflepuff player's neck, prompting uneasy glances among those present. His attention is diverted as someone tips a bag, spilling splintered wood and twisted twigs onto his bed. With a gentle breeze sweeping through, Harry listens to its whispering touch, then decisively shakes his head in response to Lupin's inquiry, releasing Hedwig from her restraints. Together with Lupin, Harry watches as she takes to the sky, soaring freely, as they stand at the lake's edge, the great doors creak open, and Fred and George stride in, casting off the Invisibility Cloak to reveal Harry looking cross. Fred briskly presses a worn roll of parchment into Harry's hand, which Harry proceeds to unfurl, revealing a blank surface until George deftly taps it with his wand, and intricate ink lines vein across it. Harry reads aloud the peculiar words etched at the top. A trapdoor swings upward as Harry's eyes cautiously peek through, pulling himself into the opening just as a door abruptly bangs open. Acting swiftly, Harry conceals himself, peering out to watch a man's boots as they descend the stairs. Meanwhile, Malfoy's eyes flick toward Hermione, his gaze dripping with disdain. Suddenly, a snowball smacks Malfoy square in the face, causing him to splutter in surprise. Disoriented, Malfoy looks around just in time to receive two more snowball hits. Hermione and Ron, sensing the tension from Crabbe and Goyle's approach, exchange apprehensive glances but before they can react, their knees buckle unexpectedly, and they tumble headfirst into the snow. Draco, overwhelmed by fear, begins to retreat cautiously, casting wary glances at the mist enveloping him. His ski mask is abruptly tugged over his eyes as he's spun around, dealt a rough kick, and sent stumbling over the rise, vanishing from view. Ron and Hermione, still frozen in shock, share a nervous look before making a hasty escape, only to slip and fall onto the cold, wet ground. As they sit up, brushing snow from their clothes, the sound of laughter fills the air, prompting Hermione's eyes to narrow in suspicion. In a revealing moment, the Invisibility Cloak slips away, uncovering a grinning Harry whose smile widens as the trio of friends regathers, forging onward through the swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Snape initiates a slideshow by waving away a moth and extinguishing a candle, showcasing an ancient woodcut of a terrifying beast. As the class silently observes a slide of a werewolf attack, Hermione eagerly awaits a response to Snape's question while Ron frowns at his book. A moth releases dust near Harry, whom he acknowledges with his palm, and he notices Malfoy's parchment with a crude caricature of himself in Quidditch robes. Later, Harry awakens in the hospital wing to Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione appearing at the foot of his bed, while a nurse removes an umbrella's spokes from a Hufflepuff player's neck and dumps splinters onto Harry's bed. Distracted by the sound of a gentle wind, Harry shakes his head at Lupin's question and releases Hedwig, watching her fly with Lupin by the lake. The great doors open, and Fred and George reveal a cross-looking Harry with the Invisibility Cloak before Fred gives Harry a blank parchment. When George touches it with his wand, intricate lines appear, and Harry reads the curious words at the top. Harry surfaces through a trapdoor and quickly hides as a man descends stairs, observing Malfoy eyeing Hermione with disdain. Suddenly, Malfoy is hit by snowballs and stumbles in confusion while Ron and Hermione watch Crabbe and Goyle comically fall into the snow. Malfoy, frightened, backs away, gets spun, and is sent tumbling out of sight as Ron and Hermione nervously exchange glances and rush off, only to fall in the snow. As they sit up, hearing laughter, Hermione suspects something, and the Invisibility Cloak drops, revealing a grinning Harry as they continue through the swirling snow together.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Snape waves the moth away, the tiny insect often associated with nocturnal habits and drawn to candlelight, blows out a candle, and a slide show begins, displaying an ancient woodcut of a horrific beast known in medieval folklore as a chimera at the front of the room. Ron frowns down at his book while the class stares mutely at a slide of an attacking werewolf, a creature from mythology that represents the transformation of man into wolf during a full moon; Hermione waits desperately for someone to respond to Snape's question. The moth flutters by Harry, releasing a tiny cloud of moth dust composed of microscopic scales into the air, which Harry lifts his palm to. Meanwhile, Malfoy's parchment, enchanted with a Disillusionment Charm for secrecy, reappears, and Harry stares at it, observing a crude caricature of himself in Quidditch robes, traditionally worn by players of the wizarding sport, being struck by lightning repeatedly. Later, Harry opens his eyes as Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione slowly come into focus, standing at the foot of his bed in the hospital wing, a place reserved for healing and recuperation at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. As Harry edges up against his pillow, a nurse in the background removes the spokes of an umbrella from a Hufflepuff player's neck, a young wizard from one of the four Hogwarts houses, prompting uncomfortable glances. Someone tips a bag of splintered wood and twisted twigs onto his bed. As Harry stares, a gentle wind, often a harbinger of weather changes, can be heard, then Harry shakes his head in response to Lupin's question and sets Hedwig, his loyal snowy owl, free of her traces. As she soars into the sky, Harry and Lupin, who is known for his expertise in Defense Against the Dark Arts, watch from the lake's edge. The great doors of the castle open and Fred and George, notorious for their mischievous antics, enter, dropping the Invisibility Cloak to reveal a cross-looking Harry. Fred slaps a worn roll of parchment, known as the Marauder's Map, into Harry's hand, which he unfurls to find it blank until George touches his wand to the parchment, causing intricate ink lines to surface and spread like veins. Harry reads the curious words at the top, "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." A trapdoor lifts, hidden within the castle's secret passageways, and Harry's eyes appear as he pulls himself up, but a door bangs open. Quickly, Harry hides and watches a man's boots, belonging to the caretaker known for his suspicious nature, descend the stairs as Malfoy's eyes shift and regard Hermione, the brightest witch of her age, with disgust. Suddenly, SPLAT! Malfoy takes a snowball to the grill, the front piece of his often smug expression, and splutters. Malfoy glances about in confusion when two more snowballs hit him. Hermione and Ron glance about uneasily as Crabbe and Goyle, Malfoy's usual companions and henchmen, start for them, but then FLUMPH! their knees buckle and they fall headfirst into the snow. Draco begins to back away fearfully, eyeing the mist, a natural phenomenon that often adds to the eerie atmosphere, when his ski mask is pulled over his eyes, he's spun about, kicked roughly, and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Ron and Hermione stand frozen, exchange a nervous glance, and dash off, but go flying and land on their pants in the snow. As they sit up, they hear laughter, and Hermione's eyes narrow in suspicion. The Invisibility Cloak drops to reveal a grinning Harry, who is smiling as the trio, bound by friendship and shared adventures, trudge through the swirling snow.

As Harry stares a gentle wind can be heard. then Harry shakes his head in response to Lupin's question and sets Hedwig free of her traces. As she soars into the sky Harry and Lupin watch from the lake's edge. The great doors open and Fred and George enter dropping the Invisibility Cloak to reveal a crosslooking Harry. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Fred slaps a worn roll of parchment into Harry's hand which he unfurls to find it blank until George touches his wand to the parchment causing intricate ink lines to surface and spread like veins. Harry reads the curious words at the top. A trapdoor lifts and Harry's eyes appear as he pulls himself up but a door bangs open. Quickly Harry hides and watches a man's boots descend the stairs as Malfoy's eyes shift and regard Hermione with disgust. Suddenly SPLAT. Malfoy takes a snowball to the grill and splutters. Malfoy glances about in confusion when two more snowballs hit him. Hermione and Ron glance about uneasily as Crabbe and Goyle start for them but then FLUMPH their knees buckle and they fall headfirst into the snow. Draco begins to back away fearfully eyeing the mist. when his ski mask is pulled over his eyes he is spun about kicked roughly and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Ron and Hermione stand frozen exchange a nervous glance and dash off but go flying and land on their pants in the snow. As they sit up they hear laughter and Hermione's eyes narrow in suspicion. The Invisibility Cloak drops to reveal a grinning Harry who is smiling as the trio trudge through the swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Snape waves the moth away blows out a candle and a slide show begins displaying an ancient woodcut of a horrific beast at the front of the room. Ron frowns down at his book while the class stares mutely at a slide of an attacking werewolf. Hermione waits desperately for someone to respond to Snape's question. The moth flutters by Harry releasing a tiny cloud of moth dust into the air which Harry lifts his palm to. Meanwhile Malfoy's parchment reappears and Harry stares at it observing a crude caricature of himself in Quidditch robes being struck by lightning repeatedly. Later Harry opens his eyes as Ron Fred George and Hermione slowly come into focus standing at the foot of his bed in the hospital wing. Malfoy glances about in confusion when two more snowballs hit him. Hermione and Ron glance about uneasily as Crabbe and Goyle start for them but then FLUMPH their knees buckle and they fall headfirst into the snow. Draco begins to back away fearfully eyeing the mist. when his ski mask is pulled over his eyes he is spun about kicked roughly and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Ron and Hermione stand frozen exchange a nervous glance and dash off but go flying and land on their pants in the snow. As they sit up they hear laughter and Hermione's eyes narrow in suspicion. The Invisibility Cloak drops to reveal a grinning Harry who is smiling as the trio trudge through the swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Snape waves the moth away blows out a candle and a slide show begins displaying an ancient woodcut of a horrific beast at the front of the room. Ron frowns down at his book while the class stares mutely at a slide of an attacking werewolf. Ron and Hermione stand frozen exchange a nervous glance and dash off but go flying and land on their pants in the snow. As they sit up they hear laughter and Hermione's eyes narrow in suspicion. The Invisibility Cloak drops to reveal a grinning Harry who is smiling as the trio trudge through the swirling snow.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Zara shoos the butterfly away, extinguishes a lantern, and a puppet show begins, depicting an ancient fresco of a comical dragon at the back of the cave. Tim scowls down at his tablet while the gathering gapes silently at an image of a dancing unicorn; Lucy anticipates eagerly for anyone to react to Zara's challenge. The butterfly flits by Sam, scattering a minuscule puff of butterfly pollen into the breeze, which Sam raises his foot to. Meanwhile, Lee's notebook reappears, and Sam gapes at it, noticing a silly caricature of himself in football gear being struck by raindrops repeatedly. Later, Sam opens his eyes as Tim, Tom, Jerry, and Lucy gradually materialize, standing at the head of his hammock in the healing tent. As Sam nestles up against his cushion, a doctor in the periphery extracts the spokes of an umbrella from a Ravenclaw dancer's shoulder, eliciting awkward glances. Someone dumps a sack of shattered glass and tangled vines onto his hammock. As Sam gazes, a soft melody can be heard, then Sam nods in response to Taylor's riddle and releases Kiwi from her bindings. As she glides into the sunset, Sam and Taylor observe from the garden's edge. The massive gates swing open and Tim and Tom enter, dropping the Cloak of Shadows to unveil a grumpy-looking Sam. Tim hands a tattered scroll to Sam, which he unfurls to find it blank until Jerry taps his staff to the scroll, causing intricate ink patterns to emerge and spread like roots. Sam examines the mysterious phrase at the top. A skylight lifts, and Sam's fingers appear as he pulls himself out, but a hatch crashes open. Quickly, Sam conceals himself and watches a woman's boots climb the ladder as Lee's gaze shifts and observes Lucy with disdain. Suddenly, SPLASH! Lee receives a pie to the face and spits. Lee peers around in bewilderment when two more pies hit him. Lucy and Tim peer around anxiously as Vince and Max advance towards them, but then THUD! their legs give way and they tumble face-first into the slush. Darla begins to retreat nervously, glancing at the fog, when her scarf is pulled over her eyes, she's spun around, nudged gently, and sent tripping over the hill and out of view. Tim and Lucy stand motionless, share an anxious glance, and scurry away, but slip and land on their backs in the slush. As they sit up, they hear giggling, and Lucy's eyes narrow in suspicion. The Cloak of Shadows falls to reveal a beaming Sam, who is grinning as the trio trek through the drifting mist.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Snape dismisses a moth and starts a slideshow, displaying an ancient woodcut of a beast. Ron frowns at his book while Hermione waits for someone to answer Snape's question. Meanwhile, Malfoy's parchment reveals a caricature of Harry in Quidditch robes hit by lightning. Harry later finds himself in the hospital wing with Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione nearby. A nurse removes umbrella spokes from a Hufflepuff player's neck, while Harry receives splintered wood on his bed. Responding to Lupin, Harry frees Hedwig, who flies away. Fred and George enter with an Invisibility Cloak, giving Harry a blank roll of parchment, which reveals intricate ink lines when touched by George's wand. As Harry pulls himself up through a trapdoor, Malfoy sneers at Hermione. Suddenly, snowballs hit Malfoy, causing chaos. Crabbe and Goyle fall into the snow, and Draco backs away fearfully. Ron and Hermione fall but hear laughter, suspecting Harry, who appears, grinning. The trio walks through the snow together.
